infrastructureServerRequirement: The server you are monitoring must be running the
integrationsDiscordInfo: Connect with Discord and view incidents directly in a channel
integrationsPrism: Connect Prism to your favorite service.
integrationsSlackInfo: Connect with Slack and see incidents in a channel
integrationsZapierInfo: Send all incidents to Zapier, and then see them everywhere
maintenanceTableActionMenuDialogTitle: Do you really want to remove this maintenance window?

fallback.actionButton: Let's create your first maintenance window!
checks: Stop sending alerts in maintenance windows
fallback.title: A maintenance window is used to:

maintenanceWindowDescription: During maintenance windows, all monitoring is suspended for selected monitors. No network checks will be performed, preventing any status updates or notifications from being triggered. Your monitors will appear frozen at their last known status, and status pages will display a maintenance indicator. Once the maintenance window ends, monitoring automatically resumes, and alerts will trigger if issues are detected. Maintenance periods do not count against uptime calculations.
monitorStatusDown: Monitor {name} ({url}) is DOWN and not responding
monitorStatusUp: Monitor {name} ({url}) is now UP and responding
monitorsToApply: Monitors to apply maintenance window to

emailSettings.labelPool: Enable connection pooling: Reuse existing connections to improve performance

emailSettings.labelRejectUnauthorized: Reject invalid certificates: Reject connections with self-signed or untrusted certificates

title: Title
uptimeCreate: The expected value is used to match against response result, and the match determines the status.
uptimeCreateJsonPath: This expression will be evaluated against the reponse JSON data and the result will be used to match against the expected value. See

uptimeGeneralInstructions.docker: Enter the Docker container name or ID. You can use either the container name (e.g., my-app) or the container ID (full 64-char ID or short ID).
uptimeGeneralInstructions.game: Enter the IP address or hostname and the port number to ping (e.g., 192.168.1.100 or example.com) and choose game type.
uptimeGeneralInstructions.http: Enter the URL or IP to monitor (e.g., https://example.com/ or 192.168.1.100) and add a clear display name that appears on the dashboard.
uptimeGeneralInstructions.https: Enter the URL or IP to monitor (e.g., https://example.com/ or 192.168.1.100) and add a clear display name that appears on the dashboard.
uptimeGeneralInstructions.ping: Enter the IP address or hostname to ping (e.g., 192.168.1.100 or example.com) and add a clear display name that appears on the dashboard.
uptimeGeneralInstructions.port: Enter the URL or IP of the server, the port number and a clear display name that appears on the dashboard.
